name: Personal Communications Settings File

content: IT professionals, system administrators, and organizations that rely on IBM host systems for business operations are the most likely to encounter NDC files. The NDC files simplify the process of setting up consistent and reliable communication environments across multiple computers or users within a network.

description: An NDC file is a configuration file used by IBM Personal Communications, a program that provides terminal emulation and connectivity tools for IBM mainframe and midrange systems. It stores settings that define how the software connects to remote systems, such as host names, communication protocols, and user preferences. Settings in NDC files may include iSeries (AS/400) connection information, which allows users to establish and manage sessions with IBM servers.

instructions: You can open NDC files with iSeries Connection Configuration tool (PCSNDC.EXE) included with IBM Personal Communications.
